sect1.title: VMDP
sect1.para: &sle; Virtual Machine Driver Pack contains Windows* disk and network device drivers, in order to enable the high-performance hosting of these unmodified guest operating systems on top of &sls;. Paravirtualized drivers for &sls; are available, but not included in this Driver Pack. Paravirtualized drivers for &sls; are distributed under an open source license and included in both physical and electronic media of &sls; and corresponding Customer Center update channels.

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: Virtualization allows the consolidation of Linux workloads on newer, more powerful, energy-efficient hardware. Paravirtualized operating systems such as &sls; are aware of the underlying virtualization platform, and can therefore interact efficiently with it. Unmodified operating systems are unaware of the virtualization platform and expect to interact directly with the hardware. Because this is not possible when consolidating servers, the hardware must be emulated for the operating system. Emulation can be slow, but it is especially troubling for high-throughput disk and network subsystems. Most performance loss occurs in this area.

sect2.title: Bringing performance
sect2.para: The device drivers in &sle; Virtual Machine Driver Pack bring many of the performance advantages of paravirtualized operating systems to unmodified operating systems because only the paravirtualized device driver (not the rest of the operating system) is aware of the virtualization platform. For example, a paravirtualized disk device driver appears as a normal, physical disk to the operating system. However, the device driver interacts directly with the virtualization platform (with no emulation) to efficiently deliver disk access, allowing the disk subsystems to operate at near native speeds in a virtualized environment, without requiring changes to existing operating systems.

sect2.title: Support Subscription
sect2.para: The customer support you receive for the &sle; Virtual Machine Driver Pack is at the same level as your SUSE Linux Enterprise support subscription.
